intro: Monadenium spinulosum, commonly known as the spiny monadenium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, typically in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to conserve water. Its spiny stems and leaves help deter herbivores and reduce water loss through transpiration.
